{"step_by_step_thinking": "Anemia is a condition characterized by a decrease in the total amount of red blood cells or hemoglobin in the blood, or a lowered ability of the blood to carry oxygen. According to the World Health Organization (WHO), anemia in pregnancy is diagnosed when the hemoglobin level is less than 11.0 gm%.", "answer_choice": "B. 11.0 gm%"}
